meta.title: Project: Gazprom Neft — Professionals 4.0
meta.description: Professionals 4.0 project for Gazprom Neft connects major corporations with talented performers.

text.firstParagraph: Gazprom Neft is a vertically integrated oil company engaged primarily in oil and gas exploration, production, and refining, as well as the production and sale of petroleum products.
text.secondParagraph: The company is one of the key drivers of the Russian economy and the fastest growing in its sector.
text.thirdParagraph: Gazprom Neft invests in the development of new technology, and social and educational projects. In 2018, the company announced the beginning of the digital overhaul of its business.

quote.text: For over a year, we’ve been working with CSSSR on this project, which is very important to the company and to me personally. I would like to emphasize the professionalism and effectiveness of the team in proactivity solving complex problems, and its commitment to fulfilling plans and targets. I’d also like to commend the team for the friendly atmosphere and rapport they helped to create.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: The main goal of the Professionals 4.0 project is to connect major corporations with talented performers. Through the project, talented individuals can find new career opportunities, solve challenging tasks, develop new skills and prove themselves in an authentic work environment.

The companies, meanwhile, get access to a huge database of business competition finalists and top performers, allowing them to quickly assemble teams for particular business tasks and reinforce internal resources, with external expertise.

Strategic partner of the project is ANO «Russia — country of opportunities», an organization that assists human resources, social and educational initiatives across Russia, was a key collaborator for the project, while several other major Russian institutions have joined the platform since it was released, including Sibur, Rostelecom and the Skolkovo Innovation Center.

The project includes an internet platform, mobile application and offline events. CSSSR is in charge of developing the front-end, including the main page, performer and company dashboards, as well as the projects page.
We assembled a team of four developers, which later grew to six. The team also includes an analyst and two software testers.
The first public version was launched in spring of 2019. Since then, our team has continued to develop new functionality and has released several major updates over the past year.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people working diligently on the project

meta.title: Project: S7 Airlines — Personal Account
meta.description: Frontend development of S7 Airlines' personal account that provides quick access to the Airline's services.

text.firstParagraph: S7 Airlines is the largest Russian domestic private airline primarily based at Moscow Domodedovo International Airport and Novosibirsk Tolmachevo Airport. S7 has the youngest fleet on the Russian air transportation market. It boasts an extensive network of routes allowing passengers to travel to 181 destinations in 26 countries all over the globe. S7 is a full member of Oneworld airline alliance.
text.secondParagraph: S7 Airlines is a part of S7 AirSpace Corporation, a major Russian holding consisting of 15 companies, doing business in passengers and cargo air transportation (both regular and charter), tourism, air flights ticket distribution, flight personnel training, aircraft repair, and other aviation and space services.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: S7 Airlines’ personal account provides quick access to the Airline’s services: customers can view their reservations and participate in the loyalty program.
We develop the entire front-end for the adaptive website of the project.

The core team consists of 4 developers and one tester, additional specialists were assigned at certain stages of the project development. The first public version was released at the end of 2018, since then, we keep working on its new functionality.

Currently we are implementing flight statistics and login through social networks, and are planning to conduct significant refactoring and improve the performance of the web application. The entire front-end is written on Next.js — a modern React framework.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.

meta.title: Mosoblgaz — Personal Account
meta.description: Mosoblgaz is one of the largest gas distribution companies in Russia providing natural gas distribution throughout the Moscow Region.

text.firstParagraph: Mosoblgaz is one of the largest gas distribution companies in Russia providing natural gas distribution throughout the Moscow Region. By using Mosoblgaz services one can apply for connection to gas networks, monitor the account balance and control gas consumption using his/her personal account on the website or in a mobile application.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: We have developed a personal account for legal entities, which allows to get quick access to Mosoblgaz services, forward documents for approval, get a detailed report on expenses or make a request to connect an object to the network.
The personal account supports role models and restrictions for individual employees.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.

meta.title: Brusnika — Internal assessment and forecasting tools
meta.description: Brusnika — is a Russian development company specializing in the construction of multi-storey residential buildings in major cities of Siberia, the Urals and the Moscow Region.

hero.title: Brusnika — Internal assessment and forecasting tools
hero.subTitle: Client

text.firstParagraph: Brusnika — is a Russian development company specializing in the construction of multi-storey residential buildings in major cities of Siberia, the Urals and the Moscow Region.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: This case will be remembered for complex logic and almost complete lack of HTML coding.

We were engaged in the development of an internal sales planning tool for Brusnika managers. Our team used Node.js to integrate into the customer’s database and output sorted data. Work with «Sales Planning» is done in an interface similar to a table editor. Thanks to this tool the company’s employees can see the real estate price growth dynamics, verify information about past transactions and forecast the value of the real estate object for months ahead.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.

quote.text: The result of our joint work was not only a software product, but also a new work style that we've developed with our colleagues. Thank you for your individual approach, courage throughout experiments and professionalism in difficult situations!

author.name: Kirill Makarkin
author.signature: Head of Managerial Projects Digitalization Group

meta.title: Mindbox — Personal Account Data Filtering / Promotion Campaigns Arbitration
meta.description: Mindbox develops a customer data platform for marketing automation, implements, and helps use cloud solutions for retail marketing.

hero.title: Mindbox — Personal Account Data Filtering / Promotion Campaigns Arbitration
hero.subTitle: Client

text.firstParagraph: Mindbox develops a customer data platform for marketing automation, implements, and helps use cloud solutions for retail marketing automation in FMCG, retail, e-commerce and other industries with large numbers of customers.
text.secondParagraph: Thanks to the platform, a client can personalize its website with dynamic content and recommendations, set up messages circulation via emails, social networks, and messengers, and ensure loyalty growth by creating virtual loyalty cards and promotions.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: We worked on two projects: development of a personal account data filtering system and a «Promotion Campaigns Arbitration» application development.
In the first project, we were faced with a non-trivial problem: we had to implement data filtering with an option to add new filters and combine them into groups in a tree structure.

Our team has developed a filtering system that supports conditions and nesting levels. After basic data sorting, a user can configure fine filtering, which enables a user to apply up to several thousand filters.

The second project also required development of a complex logic cooperating with a tree structure. Thanks to «Promotion Campaigns Arbitration» a Mindbox client can create new promotions, flexibly setting up rules of promotions interaction with each other by combining them into groups. Arbitrary nesting of groups is supported.

An unconventional drag-and-drop was developed by us for this application. For example, a user can create a «Promotions» group with subgroups «Discount», «Accrual of Points», «Gift with Purchase» and «Discount by Promotion Code», and configure the parameters of each entity.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.

meta.title: QMarketing — QAcademy
meta.description: Qmarketing Agency develops progressive digital advertising for companies operating on the Russian and European markets.

text.firstParagraph: Qmarketing Agency develops progressive digital advertising for companies operating on the Russian and European markets, invests in technological projects, and creates its own training program for marketing specialists and entrepreneurs — QAcademy.

aboutProject.title: About the Project:
text: Qmarketing Academy is an interactive system that trains to choose the most effective analytical and promotional tools. Beginner entrepreneurs, marketers, and CEOs are trained on the basis of real-life cases, have their knowledge gaps filled, and awarded certificates of successful course completion.

We were entrusted with front-end development of authorization page, user profile, interactive training block and certificate issuance page. Upon the development completion, our team integrated the developed pages with the customer's API.

imgAlt.aboutProject: Three people are working hard on the project.
